name: asherdan
text: A comment left by asherdan was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ezcmac, Sleeps, Thorfinn, Howard, chatterjee, Afkpuz, dropkickpikachu)

name: saint
text: ...no whale music available? Duck call is close enough.

name: tekende
text: They were going to provide a tape of whale songs, but when they went to record, there were just so many whales .

name: sp1derbaby
text:
Beyond the door,
There's peace I'm sure,
And I know there'll be more...
Whales in heaven.

name: waldo913
text: That was a nice job.

name: mrectomy
text: I see what you did there.

name: ted0phile
text: As long as they're sultry mating calls.

name: deimosrising
text: If it were a sexier senator I'd disagree but given the particular representative in question you are right

name: equinn2006
text: The man is the minority leader. The only thing sexier in the world of bicameral legislation is the MAJORITY leader. Plus. Charlie Rose.

name: verplanck
text: how about Ted Stevens?  Convicted member of the senate, the 'bad boy' of the club...

name: erinye
text: I came across this comment again on the day of Ted Stevens' death (which is today). Such timing.

name: wangflop
text:
Is it just me, or does Beef look hell of fat in this panel? Like a fat ass in a muu muu.

I'm sorry, Beef - I didn't mean it...

name: peterjoel
text: Heaven-issued clothing isn't very flattering

name: wulvaine
text: Hell of tubby, yo.

name: shutup_shutup
text: Who's fat?  Beef. (He is)

name: soticoto
text: All that butter and booze.

name: jhunt
text: This strip is what Achewood is all about. If you find the phrasing "chicken which has been baked in a dish" to be humorous, then Achewood is for you.  If not, my condolences.

name: chaesar
text: If you put on Charlie Rose, and she stays, it was meant to be.

name: centipede_damascus
text: Too bad it's Charlie Rose and not Alan Partridge.

name: straw
text: Molly is so curious as to why she must confirm her liking music.

name: shmuckeles
text: yeah, that's quite the raised eyebrow she's got goin on there

name: zedpower
text: I've known some people who don't like music. They're not the type you'd think lack a soul and a heart, but one day you're asking them "so what do you listen to nowadays" and they answer "i don't like music" and then you just skip a beat like you just saw a mouse eat a cow.

name: songbirdspectre
text: A comment left by songbirdspectre was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by jamb23, salvagebar, Darthemed, SotiCoto)

name: tekende
text: It is a strange thing. I mean, not liking pop music, or certain bands, or not being obsessive about it and having a large CD collection, sure, but just plain not liking music? Just not at all? Hard to fathom.

name: belgand
text: I see it more as meaning "I do not generally listen to or care much about music as a thing" not "Rhythm and melody offend me at a basic level. They are not things that I would like to hear at any time."

name: tekende
text: No, there are people who feel the latter way. I read a letter once to Dear Abby or Dear Ann or whatever by this guy who said he didn't like music, like not at all, and how it made things socially awkward for him because people just didn't get how he could dislike music.

name: belgand
text: Crazy. I have no way of comprehending that.

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
people who do not like music have some sort of Condition.

i have considered this and that's the only explanation i can come up with.

name: undyingsong
text:
You just kind of have to understand that some people have to deal with a lot of noise in their lives, like literally. Big families or something, always around, like seven TVs left on at their highest volume and at all hours, in one tiny room, etc.
So yeah in that sense, music would kind of feel like more noise added on top of that.

Sometimes it is just nice to have silence, you know?

name: cpnglxynchos
text: i can understand this, but i refer to people who straight up do not like to listen to music at all .

name: blarghamagarky
text: it's always in that kind of way where that say it too, "well ya know... I don't really like music!"

name: philosophe
text: I'm always all "what music have you heard that you think all music ever made is a waste of time?"

name: stormagnet
text: I remember something from my psych. class about there being a kind of brain damage that makes some people incapable of understanding music. Auditory agnosia or something... Man it must suck hard to have that.

name: boredom_man
text: That's fair. The next time someone tells me that they don't like music and I'm about to punch them in the heart so hard that they die, I'll check and make sure they don't have auditory agnosia first.

name: imitationcrab
text: maybe the tapes are because Rock and roll is the DEVIL'S MUSIC(???).  No rocking out in heaven, sorry.

name: hendetta
text: Man Heaven has all of Beef's favorite books and things to ingest but none of his music.

name: ttagxamm
text: Well, like the old saying goes, the Devil has all the tunes...

name: stuart
text: Oh, THAT'S what that line in The Satanic Verses meant! I thought that the narrator was Beck.

name: sp1derbaby
text: The narrator described himself in one of the chapters; really enjoyable book.

name: fermatprime
text: But Heaven has the best choreographers.

name: theguitarhero
text: YES.

name: fineoakstructure
text: That's like saying Hell has the best writers but Heaven has the best copy editors.  I know which career I'd sell my soul for.

name: drycup
text: Man, Beef, what are you wearing that is unflattering as a pop up tent

name: rowboat
text: Beef's realization in panel five is basically a main concern of my life at all times for the most part.

name: tekende
text: Speaking of mealtime noises--that scene toward the beginning of Star Wars in which Luke is eating dinner with his aunt and uncle (and they're drinking blue milk) really grosses me out, what with the noises that happen and everything.

name: rowboat
text: And damn! Right when I thought tetrisattack was done quoting the lyrics to "Heaven" word for word, here comes another Talking Heads reference.

name: tekende
text: This entire Heaven arc I have had Love and Rockets's "Everybody Wants to Go to Heaven" stuck in my head.

name: spinynorman
text:
In the second panel, Beef vaguely resembles Ray.

It is the sign the macking is rearing up in his skinny chest and will roar triumphantly. King Chochacho works his magic and possesses the little cat for one crucial moment.

Were it not for Duck Slayer (I mean really if you are killing ducks you are not a god damn warrior slayer) it would be a smooth ride.

name: spinynorman
text: You know what, this is a stupid fucking comment.

name: tekende
text: I don't know if I'd call it stupid. It was pretty weird, though.

name: c_dizzle
text: roast beef. is. adorable.

name: ovenface
text: what is up with all this talking heads?

name: postblank
text: More like what happened to all this Talking Heads?

name: soupkaty
text: aww. i love the roast beef nervousness, all wringing his hands together. yay beef and molly!

name: deovalente
text: I love chicken which has been baked in a dish !

name: charchar
text: Seriously, the boy takes your wine to brethe, gives you chicken which has been baked in a dish, and puts on duck calls: any decent person would let him get boobies at least.

name: hellofditties
text: Ohh Roast Beef I love it when you use punctuation.

name: gussiejives
text: Oh man, anybody but Mitch McConnell....

name: aaron_haynes
text: that guy is dog shit

name: sabbac
text: Beef's all "do you like... Bread?  I've got a French Loaf!  Bye.........  i love you"

name: stagnantdisplay
text: I love how the name Roy Rhodes is trademarked. Dude doesn't want anyone else all comin' up on his identity.

name: mikeronomicon
text: I definately have been that nervous on a date before. The kind of nervous that when she still wants to see you even though you were a total ass-hat, you are simultaniously relieved and slightly frightened.

name: pigeon_street
text: All this Talking Heads in the alt text is making me incredibly happy.
